verses.roman:
pradyumna miśrere prabhu rāmānanda-sthāne
kṛṣṇa-kathā śunāila kahi' tāṅra guṇe

synonyms: pradyumna miśrere—of the name Pradyumna Miśra; prabhu—Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu; rāmānanda-sthāne—at the place of Rāmānanda Rāya; kṛṣṇa-kathā—topics of Lord Śrī Kṛṣṇa; śunāila—caused to hear; kahi'-explaining; tāṅra—of Rāmānanda Rāya; guṇe—the transcendental qualities.
translation: After explaining the transcendental qualities of Rāmānanda Rāya, the Lord sent Pradyumna Miśra to the residence of Rāmānanda Rāya, and Pradyumna Miśra learned kṛṣṇa-kathā from him.
